properties.areaDesc: Wyoming Black Hills; Central Black Hills; Northern Black Hills
properties.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 5 at 8:03PM MST until February 6 at 9:00PM MST by NWS Rapid City SD
properties.description:
...SNOW EXPECTED ACROSS THE BEAR LODGE MOUNTAINS AND THE NORTHERN
AND CENTRAL BLACK HILLS...

.A clipper system will drop through the Northern Plains on
Thursday producing an extended period of upslope snow across the
Bear Lodge Mountains and the northern and central Black Hills.
Highest snow amounts will be from the Lead and Deadwood areas, to
O'Neill Pass, and south to the Deerfield Lake area.

* WHAT...Snow. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 6 inches.

* WHERE...In South Dakota, the Central Black Hills and the
Northern Black Hills. In Wyoming, the Wyoming Black Hills.

* WHEN...From 6 AM to 9 PM MST Thursday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous
conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Breezy northwest winds will produce low
visibility in open areas due to blowing snow.
properties.instruction:
Slow down and use caution while traveling.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 9 PM MST THURSDAY
